RNA makes protein well then a stretch of

150,000 uh ultimately it turns out we
only have about 20,000 protein coding

instructions for an organism as complex
as Homo sapiens there are other uh genes
that don't code for protein that are
turning out to be pretty important so in
a certain way we're rescuing our sense

other categories of genes that don't

but it is still astounding uh to think
